intro: Valerianella szovitsiana, commonly known as the Hungarian valerian, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Valerianella szovitsiana is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its mild sedative properties.
